meanings.definition: The quality or state of being luminous or shining.
meanings.sent1: The lucence of the stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The diamond's lucence caught the sunlight and sparkled brilliantly.
meanings.sent3: The lucence of the fireflies made the garden look like a magical wonderland.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a natural lucence that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The lucence of the full moon illuminated the entire forest.

meanings.definition: The property of transmitting light without diffusion or scattering.
meanings.sent1: The lucence of the crystal allowed light to pass through clearly.
meanings.sent2: The clean window's lucence made the room feel bright and airy.
meanings.sent3: The lucence of the glass made it seem like the light was dancing inside.
meanings.sent4: The lucence of the water made the fish visible from afar.
meanings.sent5: The lucence of the prism separated the light into beautiful colors.

meanings.definition: The state of being clear or transparent.
meanings.sent1: The lucence of the ice made it easy to see the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent2: The lucence of the lake allowed us to see the pebbles at the bottom.
meanings.sent3: The lucence of the glass made it hard to believe it was there.
meanings.sent4: The lucence of the air made the distant mountains appear closer.
meanings.sent5: The lucence of the diamond made it look like a drop of water.
